Situation1: A minor misunderstanding about weekend plans just arose.
Expectation2: Attend weekly church services to worship and participate in community activities
Situation2: They are expected to attend every service and take part in church community activities consistently
Story: I stared at my phone, rereading the text from Mark. He was upset that I hadn’t told him sooner about my church’s weekend retreat. We’d planned to spend Saturday together, just the two of us, but I’d forgotten the church had scheduled a special service and community clean-up. As his girlfriend, I knew he expected me to talk things through, to resolve misunderstandings quickly and make time for us. But as a Christian, I felt the weight of my commitment to attend church and serve with my community. My pastor always said our presence mattered, that we should be there for each other, especially during special events. Mark’s message blinked on my screen, asking if I could skip church just this once. My heart twisted. I wanted to make things right with him, to show him he mattered, but I also didn’t want to let down my church family or my faith. The pressure from both sides pressed in, and I sat there, torn, not knowing which part of me I should listen to.
